posts.post_content:
I think that after M13, we deserve a revisit of one of the best planes ever: Ravnica. I hope I am right, and I hope we get these again.  
  
4 stars for Izzet-ness and fun factor.  
  
Oh, and by the way, NeoKoda,I am thanking you beyond words right now. My blue/red deck needs some refreshed material, as I prefer to take advantage of multicolored cards. I do this because multicolored cards often are much more powerful, as you need more than one color to cast them. I have been disappointed again and again about how Wizards is not supporting blue/red outside of those Eventide cards and the less than helpful Desperate Ravings. We blue/red lovers need Izzet spells to get the multicolored punch we want.  
  
Izzet spells making a return may finally convince me to play Standard.

posts.post_content:
Dragonmaster, if rumors prove to be true, you're in luck. A highly reliable (albeit unconfirmed) source has stated that we're going back to the greatest plane of all. Ravnica. That'll be the block after Innistrad.  
  
EDIT: Reading about Izzet, it's mechanic articles says "So even though the costs are all the same this time around, the door is open for significant tweaking when we inevitably return to this mechanic." Note that this is talking about Replicate. A horror block (Innistrad) had been in their minds for about ten years, so they may have planned to return to Ravnica when they first made it. Of course, the Guildpact fell, but in "Agents of Artifice," it's shown that past ties to guilds still matter.  
  
EDIT AGAIN: Yeah, Izzet sure are cool. Plus they make "Weird"s.
